alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 11 at 10:49AM MST until January 11 at 11:15AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 1115 AM MST. * At 1049 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located over the area extending from Munds Park to Happy Jack to Two Guns. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility associated with intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 215 and 236. Interstate 17 between mile markers 308 and 332. State Route 179 between mile markers 312 and 313. State Route 89A between mile markers 372 and 391. Locations impacted include... Sedona, Dairy Springs Campground, Submarine Rock, Forked Pine CG, Canyon Diablo, Chimney Rock, Boot Lake, Stoneman Lake, Midgely Bridge Swimming Hole, Raymond Wildlife Area, West Fork Trailhead, Schnebly Hill Overlook, Munds Park, Dairy Springs CG, Junipine Resort, Munds Mountain Wilderness, Soldier Pass Trailhead, Lakeview, Garland's Oak Creek Lodge, and Lake View CG. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
